prs meta

Wrapper for pyreadstat to easily read, create and adjust .sav files.

Requirements:
pyreadstat 1.1.6
pandas
class src.meta.Meta(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: object

Wrapper for pyreadstat to easily read, create and adjust .sav files.

Parameters

  • path (str, optional) – path to an SPSS file. The DataFrame and metadata object will be constructed from this file, if provided.

  • df (DataFrame, optional) – pandas DataFrame. The DataFrame will be used to construct the metadata, if only a DataFrame is provided

  • meta (object, optional) – pyreadstat metadata object from SPSS file

Example (from path)
>>> M = Meta("path_to_file.sav")
>>> print(M.names)
['list', 'of', 'column', 'names']
Example (df only)
>>> df = pd.DataFrame({'col1': [1,2,3], 'col2': ['hi','hi','hi']})
>>> M = Meta(df)
>>> print(M.types['col2])
A2
Example (df + meta)
>>> M = Meta(df, meta)
>>> print(M.names)
['list', 'of', 'column', 'names']
add_column_label(col_name, col_label)[source]

Adds column names to metadata

Parameters

  • col_name (str) – column name

  • col_label (str) – column label

Example
>>> M.add_column_label("my_column", "This is my column")
>>> print(M.labels["my_column"])
This is my column
Return type

None

add_measures(col_name, measures)[source]

Adds the ‘measures’ of a column to metadata

Parameters

  • col_name (str) – column name

  • measures (str) – any of nominal, ordinal, scale

Example
>>> M.add_measures('my_column', 'nominal')
>>> print(M.measures['my_column'])
nominal
Return type

None

add_type(col_name, col_type='int', decimals=0)[source]

Adds a column’s type to metadata

Parameters

  • col_name (str) – column name

  • col_type (str, optional) – any of str, int, float. default = int

  • decimals (int, optional) – the number of decimals that numeric values should display, default = 0

Example
>>> M.df['my_column'] = [12.3311, 15.2224, 9.8832]
>>> M.add_type('my_column', 'float', decimals=3)
>>> print(M.types['my_column'])
F6.3
Return type

None

add_value_labels(col_name, val_label)[source]

Adds a column’s value labels to metadata

Parameters

  • col_name (str) – column name

  • val_label (dict[int, str]) – values mapped to labels

Example
>>> labels = {0: 'Not selected', 1: 'Selected'}
>>> M.add_value_labels('my_column', labels)
>>> print(M.value_labels['my_column'])
{0: 'Not selected', 1: 'Selected'}
Return type

None

new(col_name, col_type='int')[source]

Add a new column to the metadata

Parameters

  • col_name (str) – column name

  • col_type (str, optional) – any of int, str, float. default = int

Example
>>> M.new('my_column')
>>> M.types['my_column']
F1.0
>>> M.measures['my_column']
nominal
Return type

None

view(col_name)[source]

Prints all of the metadata for a given column

Parameters

col_name (str) – column name

Example
>>> M.df['my_column] = [1,2,3]
>>> M.new('my_column')
>>> M.view('my_column)
my_column
type: numeric (F1.0)
measure: nominal
label: my_column
value labels: undefined
missing ranges: undefined
write_to_file(filename='output.sav')[source]

Writes the DataFrame and metadata to an SPSS file

Parameters

filename (str, optional) – name of the new file

Return type

None
